title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 authorizes entrepreneurial development programs, focusing on support for entrepreneurs through various services and activities. An annual report detailing these entrepreneurial development activities must be submitted to the relevant committees in Congress. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 requires an annual report detailing entrepreneurial development activities. The report should include program descriptions, operating details, grant award processes, awardees, funding amounts, and responsible individuals for each program. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow disclosure of information to State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. Amends Small Business Act to govern data collection activities for grant applicants. Requires an annual report on data collection related to Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Amends Small Business Act regarding participation in private partnerships and cosponsorships with the Administration by Small Business Development Centers. Allows SBDCs to collect fees or income from such partnerships. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amends Small Business Act to remove certain items related to equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Amends the Small Business Act to limit the award of grants to entities that previously received grants and seek to renew them after September 30, 2014. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses affected by a major disaster, without geographic restrictions. The T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act allows small business development centers to ensure continuity of services in disaster-affected areas and access disaster recovery facilities as needed. SEC. 10. INCLUSION OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS: Amends the Small Business Act to educate unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assist them in starting new businesses.
